Study: Criminal Justice-Involved Women Navigate COVID-19: Notes From the Field.
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Illuminating disparities between those who can follow recommended actions to prevent infection and those who lack resources to do so.
Solution: Concerted efforts are required to reduce inequities that put the 1.3 million U.S. women under criminal justice supervision at risk for infection and mortality.

Study: COVID-19 Among Workers in Meat and Poultry Processing Facilities - 19 States, April 2020.
Solution: Worker symptom screening programs, policies to discourage working while experiencing symptoms compatible with COVID-19, and social distancing by workers, use of cloth face covers, increased disinfection of high-touch surfaces

Study: The effect of travel restrictions on the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak
Solution: Travel restrictions

Study: Disability, Urban Health Equity, and the Coronavirus Pandemic: Promoting Cities for All.
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Persons with disabilities living in cities are disproportionately harmed
Solution: Maintain the status quo, perpetuate even greater spatial segregation and exclusion, or to offer a vision for (re)building our cities to be more inclusive and healthier for all.

Study: Preparedness, prevention and control of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) for refugees and migrants in non-camp settings
Solution: Coordination and planning; Surveillance, case investigation and management, and infection control; Points of entry screening and quarantine safeguards; Risk communication and community engagement; Occupational health and safety measures

Study: Personal protective equipment for preventing highly infectious diseases due to exposure to contaminated body fluids in healthcare staff.
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: More difficult donning or doffing, less user comfort
Solution: Face-to-face training in PPE, covering more parts of the body

Study: COVID-19 Preparedness in Michigan Nursing Homes.
Journal: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society (JAGS)
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Most concerned about staffing and supplies/PPE.
Solution: Pandemic response, including plans to restrict visitors and vendors, be in communication with local hospitals and public health officials, and have a staff member responsible for preparedness.

Study: Special Article: Risk Communication During COVID-19
Journal: The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: In Practice
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Poor risk communication and heightened risk perception-->hoarding behavior, which can lead to lack of medications and personal protective equipment.
Solution: Utilizing social media channels, and ensuring an ongoing consistent media presence; include all stakeholders including members of the allergy community in broader public health messaging.

Study: Public perceptions and experiences of social distancing and social isolation during the COVID-19 pandemic: A UK-based focus group study
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Initial high levels of support for, and adherence to, social distancing and isolation is likely to wane over time, particularly where end dates are uncertain.
Solution: Rapid response in public health programming

Study: Self-reported compliance and attitudes about social distancing during the COVID-19 outbreak
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Found that younger, less educated individuals who do not see social distancing as effective or the norm are currently less likely to fully comply with social distancing recommendations. Barriers such as not being able to tolerate social distancing for a long time prevent individuals from doing so.
Solution: Communication campaigns (showing how distancing can help one's family and others) using trusted sources through national news networks and social media

Study: Self-Isolation Compliance in the COVID-19 Era Influenced by Compensation: Findings From a Recent Survey In Israel
Solution: Providing people with assurances for their livelihood during self-quarantine

Study: Facemasks and similar barriers to prevent respiratory illness such as COVID-19: A rapid systematic review
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Evidence is not sufficiently strong to support widespread use of facemasks as a protective measure against COVID-19.
Solution: Wearing facemasks for casual community contact

Study: Political Beliefs affect Compliance with COVID-19 Social Distancing Orders
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Non-bipartisan leader support or lack of faith in the credibility of officials issuing government orders
Solution: Stay-at-home policies

Study: The COVID-19 Pandemic: a Call to Action to Identify and Address Racial and Ethnic Disparities
Journal: Journal of Racial and Ethnic Health Disparities
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Vulnerable minorities that experience disease burden and social upheaval that includes increased mortality, limited health care access, economic collapse with loss of wages and housing, and an overall lack of resources and equity to sustain in a dynamic crisis.
Solution: A National Commission on COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Health Disparities: a dedicated body to envisage essential recourse and mobilize to action the necessary safeguards

Study: Functional Fear Predicts PublicHelath Compliance in the COVID-19 Pandemic
Solution: Fear of COVID-19 with no effect of politically-relevant variables

Study: The effectiveness of moral messages on public health behavioral intentions during the COVID-19 pandemic
Solution: Messages focused on duties and responsibilities toward family, friends and fellow citizens

Study: Age-structured impact of social distancing on the COVID-19 epidemic in India
Solution: Sustained periods of lockdown with periodic relaxation-->eventual individualised social contact tracing and quarantine

Study: Community pharmacists and communication in the time of COVID-19: Applying the health belief model
Journal: Research in Social and Administrative Pharmacy
Solution: Use Health Belief Model (HBM) as a guide

Study: The effect of control strategies to reduce social mixing on outcomes of the COVID-19 epidemic in Wuhan, China: a modelling study
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Premature and sudden lifting of interventions
Solution: Non-pharmaceutical interventions based on sustained physical distancing to reduce the acute pressure on the health-care system.

Study: Getting your workplace ready for COVID-19
Solution: Prevent the spread in workplace, when organizing meetings and events, during travel

Study: Feasibility of controlling COVID-19 outbreaks by isolation of cases and contacts
Asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmis: Long delays from symptom onset to isolation, fewer cases ascertained by contact tracing, and increasing transmission before symptoms.
Solution: Highly effective contact tracing and case isolation

Study: Emojis in public health and how they might be used for hand hygiene and infection prevention and control
Solution: Emoji use in the medical and public health literature by raising awareness with no language barrier, educating people to adopt healthy behaviors, and enhancing surveillance systems to monitor infectious diseases..
